result.execSummary:
The defendant James Edward Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $800.00 to AML Investment LLC.  Defendant to make payments of $25 per  month commencing on 10-01-15 and to be paid by the 1st of each month until paid-in-full.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.   Cash bail on dep[osit to apply.              
Court waived all Court costs due to the restitution being ordered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Edward Coleman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Check Packet

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by state, defense and defendant.
Court ordered defendant to serve 6 days in the House of Correction, with 6 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court orders restitution in the amount of $800.00 to AML Investment LLC . Payments of $25.00 per month to commence on 10/1/2015 and to be paid on the 1st of each month until paid in full.  Any payment that is more than 5 days late and any amounts due and owing will convert to a civil judgment.  The cash bail of $250.00 to be applied.
Court waived all court costs due to the restitution ordered.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Victim Impact Statement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant James Edward Coleman in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading.
Court ordered charge amended to Receiving Stolen Property as a party to a crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 943.34(1)(a) , a Class A misdemeanor
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant James Edward Coleman in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 22 on 09/02/2015 at 9:00am.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant James Edward Coleman in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith via telephone.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  State revoked their offer.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant James Edward Coleman in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant James Edward Coleman in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 04/06/2015 received and filed. (16 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Darryl Smith, Public Defender.

Defendant James Edward Coleman in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jon Duchateau-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/3/15.

15RM015692  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/24/2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Edward Coleman in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant James Edward Coleman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
